docs.lead_paragraph: YOU have probably noticed that nowadays, when you talk to young men and women of college age, they do not hear you very well. Their thoughts are elsewhere. They say, "Sure" and they say, "So do I," and often they say. "What was that?" But their eyes do not quite focus. Nor do their minds.

headline.main: Teaching, Not Facts, but How to Think; That is the job of colleges, but the times odd to the problem of catching youth's ear.

docs.abstract: Prof Highet article urges teaching to think; illus
